verses.t: O sing{H7891} Lordunto the {H3068} a new{H2319} song{H7892}; for he hath done{H6213} marvellous things{H6381}: his right hand{H3225}, and his holy{H6944} arm{H2220}, hath gotten him the victory{H3467}.
LordThe {H3068} hath made known{H3045} his salvation{H3444}: his righteousness{H6666} hath he openly shewed{H1540} in the sight{H5869} of the heathen{H1471}.openly…: or, revealed
He hath remembered{H2142} his mercy{H2617} and his truth{H530} toward the house{H1004} of Israel{H3478}: all the ends{H657} of the earth{H776} have seen{H7200} the salvation{H3444} of our God{H430}.
Make a joyful noise{H7321} Lordunto the {H3068}, all the earth{H776}: make a loud noise{H6476}, and rejoice{H7442}, and sing{H2167} praise.
Sing{H2167} Lordunto the {H3068} with the harp{H3658}; with the harp{H3658}, and the voice{H6963} of a psalm{H2172}.
With trumpets{H2689} and sound{H6963} of cornet{H7782} make a joyful noise{H7321} before{H6440} Lordthe {H3068}, the King{H4428}.
Let the sea{H3220} roar{H7481}, and the fulness{H4393} thereof; the world{H8398}, and they that dwell{H3427} therein.the fulness…: or, all it containeth
Let the floods{H5104} clap{H4222} their hands{H3709}: let the hills{H2022} be joyful{H7442} together{H3162}
Before{H6440} Lordthe {H3068}; for he cometh{H935} to judge{H8199} the earth{H776}: with righteousness{H6664} shall he judge{H8199} the world{H8398}, and the people{H5971} with equity{H4339}.
